BackCBCloseGripPulldown.name: Cable Close Grip Pulldown
BackCBCloseGripPulldown.preparation: Grasp parallel cable attachment. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBCloseGripPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBCloseGripPulldown.comments: Exercise can be performed withVBar or Multiexercise Bar.
BackCBCloseGripPulldown.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, deltoidposterior, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBAlternatingCloseGripPulldown.name: Cable Alternating Close Grip Pulldown
BackCBAlternatingCloseGripPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBAlternatingCloseGripPulldown.execution: Pull down one cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
BackCBAlternatingCloseGripPulldown.comments: Stirrups are attached to split pulley.
BackCBAlternatingCloseGripPulldown.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, deltoidposterior, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBOneArmPulldown.name: Cable One Arm Pulldown
BackCBOneArmPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrup in one hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBOneArmPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat and continue with other arm.
BackCBOneArmPulldown.comments: Muscles listed as Stabilizers become Synergists if spinal lateral flexion occurs during exercise.
BackCBOneArmPulldown.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, deltoidposterior, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBOneArmKneelingPulldown.name: Cable One Arm Kneeling Pulldown
BackCBOneArmKneelingPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrup in one hand and kneel on floor.
BackCBOneArmKneelingPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat and continue with other arm.
BackCBOneArmKneelingPulldown.comments: Muscles listed as Stabilizers become Synergists if spinal lateral flexion occurs during exercise.
BackCBOneArmKneelingPulldown.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, deltoidposterior, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBCloseGripPulldownStirrups.name: Cable Close Grip Pulldown (stirrups)
BackCBCloseGripPulldownStirrups.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBCloseGripPulldownStirrups.execution: Pull down cable attachments to sides of chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBCloseGripPulldownStirrups.comments: Stirrups are attached to split pulley.
BackCBCloseGripPulldownStirrups.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, deltoidposterior, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBKneelingBentoverPullover.name: Cable Kneeling Bent-over Pulldown
BackCBKneelingBentoverPullover.preparation: Kneel on mat slightly away from high pulley. Grasp cable rope attachment with both hands. Sit with hips back and bend down by flexing hips so torso is bent over at approximately 30 angle. Allow resistance on cable pulley to pull arms upward with elbows bent.
BackCBKneelingBentoverPullover.execution: Pull cable rope down until elbows are back and inside of rope attachment is behind neck. Return attachment over head until shoulder is completely flexed upward. Repeat.
BackCBKneelingBentoverPullover.comments: Keep hips and torso in same position throughout movement.
BackCBKneelingBentoverPullover.synergists: tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, bicepsbrachii, deltoidposterior, brachialis, teresmajor, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBFrontPulldown.name: Cable Pulldown
BackCBFrontPulldown.preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBFrontPulldown.execution: Pull down cable bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBFrontPulldown.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
BackCBFrontPulldown.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, bicepsbrachii, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, teresminor

BackCBAlternatingPulldown.name: Cable Alternating Pulldown
BackCBAlternatingPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBAlternatingPulldown.execution: Pull down one cable attachment to front side shoulder. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
BackCBAlternatingPulldown.comments: Stirrups are attached to split pulley.
BackCBAlternatingPulldown.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, bicepsbrachii, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, teresminor

BackCBParallelGripPulldown.name: Cable Parallel Grip Pulldown
BackCBParallelGripPulldown.preparation: Grasp parallel cable attachment. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBParallelGripPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBParallelGripPulldown.comments: Parallel Grip Cable Attachment is shorter than Pro Lat Bar, yet longer than Close Grip Cable Attachments.
BackCBParallelGripPulldown.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, deltoidposterior, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBFrontPulldownProLatBar.name: Cable Pulldown (pro lat bar)
BackCBFrontPulldownProLatBar.preparation: Grasp pro lat bar with wide parallel grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBFrontPulldownProLatBar.execution: Pull down cable bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBFrontPulldownProLatBar.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
BackCBFrontPulldownProLatBar.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, bicepsbrachii, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, teresminor

BackCBPulldownStirrups.name: Cable Pulldown (stirrups)
BackCBPulldownStirrups.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBPulldownStirrups.execution: Pull down cable attachments to front sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBPulldownStirrups.comments: Stirrups are attached to split pulley.
BackCBPulldownStirrups.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, bicepsbrachii, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, teresminor

BackCBPullover.name: Cable Pullover
BackCBPullover.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly, so hips are slightly lower than torso. Grasp revolving barbell cable attachment from behind. Pull to position cable attachment over chest. Fix elbows with small bend.
BackCBPullover.execution: Lower cable attachment toward pulley with elbows bent only slightly. Lower until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are inline with upper torso. Raise cable attachment over head and continue toward lower body until cable becomes very close to head. Repeat.
BackCBPullover.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise.
BackCBPullover.synergists: pectoralisminor, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, pectoralissternal, rhomboids

BackCBBentoverPullover.name: Cable Bent-over Pullover
BackCBBentoverPullover.preparation: Face high pulley and grasp revolving cable attachment with arm slightly bent. Place one foot slightly back and bend over at hip until shoulder is fully flexed (upper arms at sides of head).
BackCBBentoverPullover.execution: With elbows fixed approximately 30, pull cable attachment down until upper arms are to sides. Return attachment overhead. Repeat.
BackCBBentoverPullover.comments: Fix elbows approximately 30 throughout exercise. Also known as Straight Arm Pulldown.
BackCBBentoverPullover.synergists: pectoralisminor, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, pectoralissternal, rhomboids

BackCBSeatedStraightArmPullover.name: Cable Seated Pullover
BackCBSeatedStraightArmPullover.preparation: Sit on bench facing away from cable pulley apparatus. Grasp revolving cable attachment over head with overhand grip.
BackCBSeatedStraightArmPullover.execution: With elbows fixed with slight bend, pull cable attachment forward and down as far as possible. Return cable attachment forward and overhead. Repeat.
BackCBSeatedStraightArmPullover.comments: If cable attachment is too high, grasp attachment first, then sit down. Fix elbows approximately 30 throughout exercise. Also known as Cable Seated Straight Arm Pulldown.
BackCBSeatedStraightArmPullover.synergists: pectoralisminor, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, pectoralissternal, rhomboids

BackCBUnderhandChinup.name: Cable Chin-up
BackCBUnderhandChinup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt chains. Step up and grasp bars with shoulder width underhand grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
BackCBUnderhandChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBUnderhandChinup.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.
BackCBUnderhandChinup.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, deltoidposterior, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBParallelCloseGripChinup.name: Cable Parallel Close Grip Pull-up
BackCBParallelCloseGripChinup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. Step up and grasp close grip p arallel bars with hands facing inward. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
BackCBParallelCloseGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBParallelCloseGripChinup.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.
BackCBParallelCloseGripChinup.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, deltoidposterior, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBParallelGripChinup.name: Cable Parallel Grip Pull-up
BackCBParallelGripChinup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. Step up and grasp parallel bars with hands facing inward. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
BackCBParallelGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBParallelGripChinup.comments: This particular apparatus could arguably be referred to as lever machine since dip belt attaches to lever arm, although relatively free movement between lever and dip belt offers qualities similar to cable machine. If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.
BackCBParallelGripChinup.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, deltoidposterior, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBPullup.name: Cable Pull-up
BackCBPullup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt. Step up and grasp bars with overhand wide grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
BackCBPullup.execution: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBPullup.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
BackCBPullup.synergists: infraspinatus, rhomboids, levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, bicepsbrachii, deltoidposterior, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, teresminor

BackCBRearPullup.name: Cable Rear Pull-up
BackCBRearPullup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt. Step up and grasp bars with overhand wide grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
BackCBRearPullup.execution: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBRearPullup.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom of motion, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
BackCBRearPullup.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBRearPulldown.name: Cable Rear Pulldown
BackCBRearPulldown.preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBRearPulldown.execution: Pull cable bar down behind neck. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBRearPulldown.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
BackCBRearPulldown.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

BackCBTwistingOverheadPull.name: Cable Twisting Standing Overhead Pull
BackCBTwistingOverheadPull.preparation: Stand facing very high pulley. Grasp stirrup in one hand and step back so arm is straight. With leg of opposite side as loaded arm, plant forefoot far back on floor. Slightly bend knee of forward leg, same direction as foot.
BackCBTwistingOverheadPull.execution: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest and rotate body toward side of pulling arm. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
BackCBTwistingOverheadPull.comments: In standing position, both spinal rotation and hip rotation contribute to bodys rotation. Because rear leg is only supported by forefoot, hip of forward leg is utilized (hip internal rotation  transverse adduction) much greater than hip of rear leg since forward leg offers more secured base of support. Opposite Stance With the legs in opposite stance, body will be turned more away from cable, resulting in slight difference of muscle involvement throughout movement. During movement less spinal rotationmore hip external rotators  transverse abduction (forwardopposite side hip)less hip internal rotators  transverse adduction (rearsame side hip) Near end of pull less shoulder extensionmore shoulder transverse extension
BackCBTwistingOverheadPull.synergists: hipexernalrotators, levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, gluteusminimus, adductors, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, gluteusmedius, tensorfasciaelatae, deltoidposterior, iliopsoas, teresmajor, quadratuslumborum, erectorspinae, rhomboids, obliques

BackCBUnderhandPulldown.name: Cable Underhand Pulldown
BackCBUnderhandPulldown.preparation: Grasp cable bar with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
BackCBUnderhandPulldown.execution: Pull down cable bar to upper chest until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BackCBUnderhandPulldown.synergists: levatorscapulae, brachioradialis, pectoralissternal, brachialis, deltoidposterior, trapeziusmiddle, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor, rhomboids
